qas.question: When was 'From This Day Forward' released?
Where was 'From This Day Forward' set?

context: Mid-20th century movies set in the Bronx portrayed densely settled, working-class, urban culture. Hollywood films such as From This Day Forward (<a0_0>1946<a0_0/>), set in <a1_0>Highbridge<a1_0/>, occasionally delved into Bronx life. Paddy Chayefsky's Academy Award-winning Marty was the most notable examination of <a3_0>working class Bronx life<a3_0/> was also explored by Chayefsky in his <a2_0>1956<a2_0/> film The Catered Affair, and in the 1993 Robert De Niro/Chazz Palminteri film, A Bronx Tale, Spike Lee's 1999 movie Summer of Sam, centered in <a4_0>an Italian-American Bronx community<a4_0/>, 1994's I Like It Like That that takes place in the predominantly Puerto Rican neighborhood of the South Bronx, and Doughboys, the story of two Italian-American brothers in danger of losing their bakery thanks to one brother's gambling debts.
